english_translation: Narrated from Ibn Taus from Ikramah ibn Khalid: Malik al-Ashtar entered upon Ali and said: The people have objected to some matters and said: 'How similar is tonight to yesterday! We objected to a matter and we find ourselves in the like of it.' He said: And with him were al-Hasan ibn Ali and Abdullah ibn Abbas. Then Ali said: 'O boy! Bring me the Jami'ah (collective statement of pact) and the sword.' Then al-Hasan and Ibn Abbas stood and said: 'O Commander of the Believers, we beseech you by Allah!' They continued speaking to him until he abandoned it and said to him: 'Go away.' He went out quickly and descended the steps of the house in fear. Then Ali said when he left: 'He separated us, so we separated him. So which of us was more destructive to his companion?'

english_translation: Narrated from Ali ibn Zaid from al-Hasan from Qays ibn Ubadah, saying: We were with Ali and whenever he witnessed a sight, or looked over a hill, or descended into a valley, he would say: 'Allah and His Messenger have spoken the truth.' I said to a man from Banu Yashkur: 'Let us go to the Commander of the Believers until we ask him about his saying: Allah and His Messenger have spoken the truth.' He said: We went to him and said: 'O Commander of the Believers, we saw you whenever you witnessed a sight, or descended into a valley, or looked over a hill, you would say: Allah and His Messenger have spoken the truth. Did the Messenger of Allah ﷺ make a covenant with you regarding this?' He said and we pressed him, so when he saw that, he said: 'By Allah, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ did not make any covenant with me except something he made with all people. However, the people attacked Uthman and killed him. In this matter, others were in worse condition and worse action than me. Then I saw that I was the most deserving of this matter, so I overtook it. Allah knows if we were right or wrong.'

english_translation: Narrated from al-A'mash, saying: Uthman said to Hudhayfah when he met him: 'By Allah, what reaches me about you in secret does not stop me.' Then Hudhayfah left, but when he had gone, Uthman said: 'Bring him back!' Then Uthman said to him also like his first saying. So Hudhayfah said to him: 'By Allah, you will come out as a bull comes out, and you will be discontent as a camel is discontent.'
